khippaṃ dhammaṃ vijānāti, jivhā sūpa-rasaṃ yathā.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: acquiring demerit; accumulation of bad deeds

Meaning IN CONTEXT: not practiced by ordinary people; not frequented by common folk; lit. not used by individual person

Meaning IN CONTEXT: gone away; disappeared; without; free (from); rid (of); -less

Example1:
hirīmatā ca dujjīvaṃ, niccaṃ sucigavesinā,

Meaning IN CONTEXT: unattached (to); not bound (to); independent (from); lit. not tied back (on)

Meaning IN CONTEXT: without fault; guiltless; innocent; lit. not corrupt

Example 2:
yo daṇḍena adaṇḍesu, appaduṭṭhesu dussati,

Meaning IN CONTEXT: vigilant; careful; alert; diligent; not negligent
Example1:

Meaning IN CONTEXT: small; insignificant; lit. small in measure

Meaning IN CONTEXT: delighting in diligence; devoted to conscientiousness; lit. delighting in not heedlessness

Example1:

Meaning IN CONTEXT: gaining little; who gets few things

andhabhūto ayaṃ loko, tanuk'ettha vipassati,

Meaning IN CONTEXT: weak; feeble; not strong; not powerful

cha cābhiṭhānāni abhabbo kātuṃ

Meaning IN CONTEXT: not knowing the danger (of); not wary (of); not fearful (of); not apprehensive (of); lit. not seeing danger (in)
Example1:

abhaye bhayadassino, bhaye c'ābhaya-dassino,
micchādiṭṭhisamādānā, sattā gacchanti duggatiṃ.

dantaṃ nayanti samitiṃ, dantaṃ rājā-abhirūhati,

yaṃ kiñci yiṭṭhaṃ va hutaṃ va loke, saṃvaccharaṃ yajetha puññapekkho,

Meaning IN CONTEXT: who lives the Dhamma; who practices the teaching; who walks in truth

es’ānisaṃso dhamme suciṇṇe,

Meaning IN CONTEXT: firmly established in the Dhamma; righteous; just; moral; virtuous; lit. standing on Dhamma
Commentary:
(SNa) dhammaṭṭhā sīlasampannā'ti tasmiṃ dhamme ṭhitattā tena'pi sīlena sampannattā dhammaṭṭhā sīlasampannā.
(DHPa) dhammaṭṭhan'ti navavidhalokuttaradhamme ṭhitaṃ, sacchikatalokuttaradhamman'ti attho.
(SNPa) dhammaṭṭho'ti catusaccadhamme ṭhito.
Example1:
sīladassanasampannaṃ, dhammaṭṭhaṃ saccavedinaṃ,
attano kamma kubbānaṃ, taṃ jano kurute piyaṃ.
Example 2:
“sa ve samm’addaso bhikkhu, parijānāti vedanā.
so vedanā pariññāya, diṭṭhe dhamme anāsavo.
kāyassa bhedā dhammaṭṭho, saṅkhyaṃ n’opeti vedagū”ti.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: gift of the Dhamma; present of the Teaching
Example1:

sabba-ratiṃ dhammarati jināti, taṇhakkhayo sabbadukkhaṃ jināti.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: who knows the Dhamma by heart; lit. Dhamma bearer
Example1:

yo ca appam'pi sutvāna, dhammaṃ kāyena passati,

Meaning IN CONTEXT: verse of the teaching; line of Dhamma

Example 2:

Meaning IN CONTEXT: who drinks the Dhamma; who delights in the Dhamma

Meaning IN CONTEXT: flavour of delight in the Dhamma; juice of joy in the teaching

Meaning IN CONTEXT: supreme teaching; highest Dhamma; ultimate reality; ultimate nature of things

Example1:

Meaning IN CONTEXT: (something) treasured; cherished; taken as “mine”; made “mine”; possession

Example1:
sabbaso nāmarūpasmiṃ, yassa n'atthi mamāyitaṃ,

Meaning IN CONTEXT: of me alone; only mine; mine alone
Example1:
mam'eva kata maññantu, gihīpabbajitā ubho,
mam'ev'ātivasā assu, kicc'ākiccesu kismici.
iti bālassa saṅkappo, icchā māno ca vaḍḍhati.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: made of; produced by; born of; lit. measuring by
Example1:

manasā ce pasannena, bhāsati vā karoti vā.
tato naṃ sukham’anveti, chāyā’va anapāyinī
Example 2: kusalā cetanā kām’āvacarā rūp’āvacarā dāna-mayā sīla-mayā bhāvanā-mayā — ayaṃ vuccati puññ’ābhisaṅkhāro.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: ending in death; culminating in death

parijiṇṇam'idaṃ rūpaṃ, roganīḷaṃ pabhaṅguraṃ,

Meaning IN CONTEXT: insubstantial; illusory; lit. mirage like nature

tato malā malataraṃ, avijjā paramaṃ malaṃ,

anupubbena medhāvī, thokaṃ thokaṃ khaṇe khaṇe.

evaṃ atidhonacārinaṃ, sāni kammāni nayanti duggatiṃ.

na pupphagandho paṭivātam'eti, na candanaṃ tagara-mallikā,

middhī yadā hoti mahagghaso ca, niddāyitā samparivattasāyī,

varam’assatarā dantā, ājānīyā ca sindhavā,

Meaning IN CONTEXT: of great wisdom; very wise; extremely intelligent
Example1:
vītataṇho anādāno, niruttipadakovido,
akkharānaṃ sannipātaṃ, jaññā pubb'āparāni ca,

middhī yadā hoti mahagghaso ca, niddāyitā samparivattasāyī,

pupphāni h'eva pacinantaṃ, byāsattamanasaṃ naraṃ,

appassut’āyaṃ puriso, balibaddho’va jīrati,

Example 2: ‘atthi imasmiṃ kāye kesā lomā nakhā dantā taco maṃsaṃ nhāru aṭṭhi aṭṭhimiñjaṃ vakkaṃ hadayaṃ yakanaṃ kilomakaṃ pihakaṃ papphāsaṃ

Example1:

mātaraṃ pitaraṃ hantvā, rājāno dve ca khattiye,
raṭṭhaṃ sānucaraṃ hantvā, anīgho yāti brāhmaṇo.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: overestimating oneself to be; overrating oneself to be; lit. thinking; imagining
Example1:
yo bālo maññati bālyaṃ, paṇḍito vā'pi tena so,
bālo ca paṇḍita-mānī, sa ve bālo'ti vuccati.

Example1:

yo sahassaṃ sahassena, saṅgāme mānuse jine,
ekañ'ca jeyya'm'attānaṃ, sa ve saṅgāmaj'uttamo

Meaning IN CONTEXT: Mara’s realm; sphere of death; power of death
Example1:
vārijo'va thale khitto, okam'okata'ubbhato,

yathā'pi puppharāsimhā, kayirā mālāguṇe bahū,
evaṃ jātena maccena, kattabbaṃ kusalaṃ bahuṃ.

yassa accantadussīlyaṃ, māluvā sālam'iv'otthataṃ,

Example 2:
manujassa pamattacārino, taṇhā vaḍḍhati māluvā viya,
so plavatī hurā huraṃ, phalam'icchaṃ'va vanasmi vānaro.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: month after month; lit. in month in month
Example1:
māse māse kus'aggena, bālo bhuñjeyya bhojanaṃ,

māse māse sahassena, yo yajetha sataṃ samaṃ,
ekañ'ca bhāvit'attānaṃ, muhuttam'api pūjaye,
sā'y'eva pūjanā seyyo, yañ'ce vassasataṃ hutaṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: believing in wrong views; accepting wrong theories; lit. taking up wrong beliefs

Example 2:
abhaye bhayadassino, bhaye c'ābhayadassino,
micchādiṭṭhisamādānā, sattā gacchanti duggatiṃ.

Example1:
diso disaṃ yaṃ taṃ kayirā, verī vā pana verinaṃ,
micchāpaṇihitaṃ cittaṃ, pāpiyo naṃ tato kare.

asāre sāramatino, sāre c'āsāradassino,
te sāraṃ n'ādhigacchanti, micchāsaṅkappa-gocarā.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: who speaks in moderation; who is measured in speech
Example1:
porāṇam'etaṃ atula, n'etaṃ ajjatanām'iva,

middhī yadā hoti mahagghaso ca, niddāyitā samparivattasāyī,

appamādo amatapadaṃ, pamādo maccuno padaṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: who has control of one's mouth; who can keep quiet; verbally restrained
Commentary: (DHPa) mukhasaṃyato'ti dāsacaṇḍāl'ādayo'pi, tvaṃ dujjāto, tvaṃ dussīlo'tiādīnaṃ avacanatāya mukhena saṃyato.
Example1:
yo mukhasaṃyato bhikkhu, mantabhāṇī anuddhato,
atthaṃ dhammañ'ca dīpeti, madhuraṃ tassa bhāsitaṃ.

Commentary: (DHPa) sajjukhīraṃ vā'ti taṃ khaṇaṃ'y'eva dhenuyā thanehi nikkhantaṃ abbhuṇhaṃ khīraṃ na muccati na pariṇamati. idaṃ vuttaṃ hoti, yathā idaṃ sajjukhīraṃ taṃ khaṇaññ'eva na muccati na pariṇamati na pakatiṃ vijahati.
Example1:
na hi pāpaṃ kataṃ kammaṃ, sajju khīraṃ'va muccati,
ḍahantaṃ bālam'anveti, bhasmacchanno'va pāvako.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: releases; lets go; emits; lit. frees
Example1:

sabbattha vimuttamānaso, na punaṃ jātijaraṃ upehisi.

na brāhmaṇassa pahareyya, n'āssa muñcetha brāhmaṇo,

na muṇḍakena samaṇo, abbato alikaṃ bhaṇaṃ.
icchā-lobha-samāpanno, samaṇo kiṃ bhavissati.

yo ca pubbe pamajjitvā, pacchā so na-ppamajjati.
so’maṃ lokaṃ pabhāseti, abbhā mutto’va candimā.
Example 2: “upādiyamāno kho, bhikkhu, baddho mārassa; anupādiyamāno mutto pāpimato”ti.

Example1:

yo munāti ubho loke, “muni” tena pavuccati.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: lying; false speech; lit. speaking lie
Example1:

Example1:

Meaning IN CONTEXT: friendly; kind; lit. living with friendliness

(DHPa) mettāvihārī'ti mettākammaṭṭhāne kammaṃ karonto'pi mettāvasena tikacatukkajjhāne nibbattetvā ṭhito'pi mettāvihārī'y'eva nāma.

pare ca na vijānanti, mayam'ettha yamāmase,

Example1:

idh’evam’eso lokasmiṃ, mūlaṃ khaṇati attano.

yo ve uppatitaṃ kodhaṃ,

sabbā te phāsukā bhaggā, gahakūṭaṃ visaṅkhataṃ,
visaṅkhāragataṃ cittaṃ, taṇhānaṃ khayam’ajjhagā.

Example1: s’āyaṃ nhānīyapiṇḍi sneh’ānugatā snehaparetā santarabāhirā, phuṭā snehena na ca paggharaṇī.
Example 2:
chandajāto anakkhāte, manasā ca phuṭo siyā,
kāmesu ca appaṭibaddhacitto, uddhaṃsoto'ti vuccati.

Example1:
‘pheṇa-piṇḍ’ūpamaṃ rūpaṃ, vedanā bubbuḷ’ūpamā.
marīcik’ūpamā saññā, saṅkhārā kadal’ūpamā.
māy’ūpamañ’ca viññāṇaṃ, desit’ādicca’bandhunā.
Example 2:
pheṇa-upamaṃ kāyam'imaṃ viditvā, marīcidhammaṃ abhisambudhāno,
chetvāna mārassa papupphakāni, adassanaṃ maccurājassa gacche.

Example1: “yesaṃ me manussānaṃ vadhena vā bandhena vā jāniyā vā garahāya vā uppajjeyyuṃ sokaparideva-dukkhadomanass’upāyāsā, atthi me tesu chandarāgo.
Example 2:
akkosaṃ vadha-bandhañ'ca, aduṭṭho yo titikkhati,
khantībalaṃ bal'ānīkaṃ, tam'ahaṃ brūmi brāhmaṇaṃ.

abhivādana-sīlissa, niccaṃ vuḍḍh’āpacāyino,
cattāro dhammā vaḍḍhanti, āyu vaṇṇo sukhaṃ balaṃ.

Example1: “seyyathā’pi, āvuso, kāḷo ca balibaddo odāto ca balībaddo ekena dāmena vā yottena vā saṃyuttā assu.
Example 2:
appassut’āyaṃ puriso, balibaddho’va jīrati,
maṃsāni tassa vaḍḍhanti, paññā tassa na vaḍḍhati.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: abolished; abandoned; removed; renounced; lit. kept away
Example1: kathañ’ca bhikkhu brāhmaṇo hoti? bāhit’āssa honti pāpakā akusalā dhammā, saṃkilesikā, ponobbhavikā, sadarā, dukkhavipākā, āyatiṃ, jātijarāmaraṇiyā.
Example 2:
bāhita-pāpo'ti brāhmaṇo, samacariyā samaṇo'ti vuccati,
pabbājayam'attano malaṃ, tasmā pabbajito'ti vuccati.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: of the Buddhas; of Awakened Ones
Example1:
āraddhavīriye pahit’atte, niccaṃ daḷha-parakkame.
samagge sāvake passa, etaṃ buddhāna’vandanaṃ.
Example 2:
sabba-pāpassa akaraṇaṃ, kusalassa upasampadā.
sacitta-pariyodapanaṃ, etaṃ buddhāna sāsanaṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: the Buddhas' teaching; the Buddhas' message; the Buddhas' religion
Commentary: (ANa) saraṃ buddhānasāsanan'ti buddhānaṃ sāsanaṃ sarantena.
Example1:
ko sutvā nappasīdeyya,
api kaṇh'ābhijātiyo,
tasmā hi attakāmena,
mahattam'abhikaṅkhatā,
saddhammo garukātabbo,
saraṃ buddhāna'sāsanan'ti.
Example 2:
sabbapāpassa akaraṇaṃ, kusalass'ūpasampadā.
sacittapariyodapanaṃ, etaṃ buddhāna'sāsanaṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: living the holy life; following the spiritual path; who is celibate renunciant
Example1:
kāmesu brahmacariyavā, vītataṇho sadā sato,
saṅkhāya nibbuto bhikkhu, tassa no santi iñjitā.
Example 2:
yodha puññañ'ca pāpañ'ca, bāhetvā brahmacariyavā.
saṅkhāya loke carati, sa ve “bhikkhū”ti vuccati.

Example1: “yo ubho’nte viditvāna, majjhe mantā na lippati. taṃ brūmi mahāpuriso’ti, so’dha sibbinim’accagā”ti.
Example 2:
yo ve uppatitaṃ kodhaṃ, rathaṃ bhantaṃ'va vāraye,
tam'ahaṃ sārathiṃ brūmi, rasmiggāho itaro jano.

gahakāraka diṭṭho’si, puna gehaṃ na kāhasi,
sabbā te phāsukā bhaggā, gahakūṭaṃ visaṅkhataṃ,
visaṅkhāragataṃ cittaṃ, taṇhānaṃ khayam’ajjhagā.

Example1: na sotaṃ odahati, na aññā cittaṃ upaṭṭhapeti, na ca taṃ purisaṃ bhajati, na ca tena vittiṃ āpajjati.
Example 2:
mitte bhajassu kalyāṇe, suddhājīve atandite,
paṭisanthāravuty'assa, ācārakusalo siyā,
tato pāmojjabahulo, dukkhass'antaṃ karissati.

Example1:
kalyāṇamittatā muninā, lokaṃ ādissa vaṇṇitā.
kalyāṇamitte bhajamāno, api bālo paṇḍito assa.
Example 2:
nidhīnaṃ’va pavattāraṃ, yaṃ passe vajjadassinaṃ,
niggayhavādiṃ medhāviṃ, tādisaṃ paṇḍitaṃ bhaje,
tādisaṃ bhajamānassa, seyyo hoti na pāpiyo.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: (of a vehicle) swerved; veered off course; out of control; lit. spun
Example1:
eko pubbe caritvāna, methunaṃ yo nisevati,
yānaṃ bhantaṃ va taṃ loke, hīnam’āhu puthujjanaṃ.
Example 2:
yo ve uppatitaṃ kodhaṃ, rathaṃ bhantaṃ'va vāraye,
tam'ahaṃ sārathiṃ brūmi, rasmiggāho itaro jano.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: startled by fear; threatened by danger
Example1: mataṃ me jīvitā seyyaṃ, tasmā araññaṃ pavisitvā ubbandhitvā marissāmī”ti araññaṃ gato maraṇa-bhayatajjito paṭinivatti.
Example 2:
bahuṃ ve saraṇaṃ yanti, pabbatāni vanāni ca,
ārāma-rukkha-cetyāni, manussā bhayatajjitā
English chant 2: Going to True and False Refuges

Example1:
upasanto uparato, manta-bhāṇī anuddhato.
dhunāti pāpake dhamme, duma-pattaṃ’va māluto
Example 2:
porāṇam'etaṃ atula, n'etaṃ ajjatanām'iva,
nindanti tuṇhim'āsīnaṃ, nindanti bahubhāṇinaṃ,
mita-bhāṇim'pi nindanti, n'atthi loke anindito.

Example1: ‘na kho ahaṃ tassa sukhassa bhāyāmi, yaṃ taṃ sukhaṃ aññatr’eva kāmehi aññatra akusalehi dhammehī’ti.
Example 2:
sabbe tasanti daṇḍassa, sabbe bhāyanti maccuno,
attānaṃ upamaṃ katvā, na haneyya na ghātaye.

Example1: āloka-saññaṃ manasi kareyyāsi, divāsaññaṃ adhiṭṭhaheyyāsi – yathā divā tathā rattiṃ yathā rattiṃ tathā divā. iti vivaṭena cetasā apariyonaddhena sa’p’pabhāsaṃ cittaṃ bhāveyyāsi
Example 2:
kaṇhaṃ dhammaṃ vippahāya, sukkaṃ bhāvetha paṇḍito,
okā anokam’āgamma, viveke yattha dūramaṃ.

Example1:
yañ’hi kayirā tañ’hi vade, yaṃ na kayirā na taṃ vade.
akarontaṃ bhāsamānaṃ, parijānanti paṇḍitā.
Example 2:
bahum'pi ce sahitaṃ bhāsamāno, na takkaro hoti naro pamatto,
gopo'va gāvo gaṇayaṃ paresaṃ, na bhāgavā sāmaññassa hoti.

Example1: upakkhalitvā vā papateyyaṃ, bhattaṃ vā me bhuttaṃ byāpajjeyya, pittaṃ vā me kuppeyya, semhaṃ vā me kuppeyya, satthakā vā me vātā kuppeyyuṃ,
Example 2:
seyyo ayoguḷo bhutto, tatto aggisikh'ūpamo,
yañ'ce bhuñjeyya dussīlo, raṭṭhapiṇḍam'asaññato.

Example1: evaṃ sammā vimuttacittassa, bhante, bhikkhuno bhusā ce'pi cakkhuviññeyyā rūpā cakkhussa āpāthaṃ āgacchanti, n'ev'assa cittaṃ pariyādiyanti.
Example 2:
yassa chattiṃsati sotā, manāpasavanā bhusā,
vāhā vahanti duddiṭṭhiṃ, saṅkappā rāganissitā.

Example1: ‘ayaṃ kho me kāyo rūpī cātumahā-bhūtiko mātāpettika-sambhavo odana-kummās’ūpacayo anicc’ucchādana-parimaddana-bhedana-viddhaṃsana-dhammo’
Example 2:
vedanaṃ pharusaṃ jāniṃ, sarīrassa ca bhedanaṃ,
garukaṃ vā'pi ābādhaṃ, cittakkhepañ'ca pāpuṇe.

Example1: yathā vā pan’eke bhonto samaṇa-brāhmaṇā saddhā-deyyāni bhojanāni bhuñjitvā te evarūpaṃ tiracchānakathaṃ anuyuttā viharanti.
Example 2:
māse māse kusaggena, bālo bhuñjeyya bhojanaṃ,
na so saṅkhātadhammānaṃ, kalaṃ agghati soḷasiṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: denigrating; erasing; depreciation of another's worth; lit. smearing
Notes: see BHSD mrakṣa for discussion on meaning
Example1: upanāhissa upanāho pahīno hoti, makkhissa makkho pahīno hoti, paḷāsissa paḷāso pahīno hoti, issukissa issā pahīnā hoti
Example 2:
aṭṭhīnaṃ nagaraṃ kataṃ, maṃsalohita-lepanaṃ,
yattha jarā ca maccu ca, māno makkho ca ohito.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: realm of death; sphere of Mara; power of death
Example 2:
ye ca kho sammad-akkhāte, dhamme dhamm’ānuvattino,
te janā pāram’essanti, maccudheyyaṃ suduttaraṃ.

Example1: idha ariyasāvako vigata-mala-maccherena cetasā agāraṃ ajjhāvasati muttacāgo payatapāṇi vossaggarato yācayogo dānasaṃvibhāgarato. ayaṃ vuccati cāgasampadā.
Example 2:
mal'itthiyā duccaritaṃ, maccheraṃ dadato malaṃ,
malā ve pāpakā dhammā, asmiṃ loke paramhi ca.

Example1: na sotaṃ odahissanti na aññā cittaṃ upaṭṭhāpessanti na ca te dhamme uggahetabbaṃ pariyāpuṇitabbaṃ maññissanti.
Example 2:
madhu'vā maññati bālo, yāva pāpaṃ na paccati,
yadā ca paccati pāpaṃ, bālo dukkhaṃ nigacchati.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: moderation (in); knowing the measure or limit (of); temperance (in)
Example 2:
anūpavādo anūpaghāto, pātimokkhe ca saṃvaro,
mattaññutā ca bhattasmiṃ, pantañ’ca sayan’āsanaṃ,
adhicitte ca āyogo, etaṃ buddhāna sāsanaṃ.
Example 3: na kamm'ārāmatā, na bhass'ārāmatā, na nidd'ārāmatā, na saṅgaṇik'ārāmatā, indriyesu guttadvāratā, bhojane mattaññutā, asaṃsagg'ārāmatā, nippapañc'ārāmatā.

Example1: atha kho tesaṃ, bhikkhave, dvinnaṃ jāyampatikānaṃ kantāragatānaṃ yā parittā sambala-mattā, sā parikkhayaṃ pariyādānaṃ gaccheyya.
Example 2:
mattā-sukha-pariccāgā, passe ce vipulaṃ sukhaṃ,
caje mattāsukhaṃ dhīro, sampassaṃ vipulaṃ sukhaṃ.

Example1: atthi, bhikkhave, sattānaṃ kāyaduccaritaṃ vacīduccaritaṃ manoduccaritaṃ. tassa taṃ ṭhānaṃ abhiṇhaṃ paccavekkhato sabbaso vā duccaritaṃ pahīyati tanu vā pana hoti.
Example 2:
manopakopaṃ rakkheyya, manasā saṃvuto siyā,
manoduccaritaṃ hitvā, manasā sucaritaṃ care.

Example1:
upasanto uparato, manta-bhāṇī anuddhato.
dhunāti pāpake dhamme, duma-pattaṃ’va māluto
Example 2:
asajjhāya-malā mantā, anuṭṭhāna-malā gharā,
malaṃ vaṇṇassa kosajjaṃ, pamādo rakkhato malaṃ.

Example1:
‘pheṇa-piṇḍ’ūpamaṃ rūpaṃ, vedanā bubbuḷ’ūpamā.
marīcik’ūpamā saññā, saṅkhārā kadal’ūpamā.
māy’ūpamañ’ca viññāṇaṃ, desit’ādicca’bandhunā.
Example 2:
yathā pubbuḷakaṃ passe, yathā passe marīcikaṃ,
evaṃ lokaṃ avekkhantaṃ, maccurājā na passati.

Example1: seyyathā’pi, āvuso yamaka, gahapati vā gahapatiputto vā aḍḍho mahaddhano mahābhogo; so ca ārakkha-sampanno.
Example 2:
vāṇijo'va bhayaṃ maggaṃ, appasattho mahaddhano,
visaṃ jīvitu'kāmo'va, pāpāni parivajjaye.

Example1: seyyathā’pi, bhikkhave, māyākāro vā māyākār’antevāsī vā catu-mahāpathe māyaṃ vidaṃseyya.
Example 2:
yathā saṅkāraṭhānasmiṃ, ujjhitasmiṃ mahāpathe,
padumaṃ tattha jāyetha, sucigandhaṃ manoramaṃ.

Example1: mātari pitari c’āpi, atho jeṭṭhamhi bhātari. ācariye catutthamhi, tesu na mānaṃ kayirātha.
Example 2:
yāva hi vanatho na chijjati, aṇumatto'pi narassa nārisu,
paṭibaddhamano'va tāva so, vaccho khīrapako'va mātari.

Example1: es’ev’anto mān’ānusayānaṃ, es’ev’anto bhavarāg’ānusayānaṃ, es’ev’anto avijj’ānusayānaṃ
Example 2:
mam’eva kata'maññantu, gihī-pabbajitā ubho,
mam’ev’ātivasā assu, kicc'ākiccesu kismici.
iti bālassa saṅkappo, icchā māno ca vaḍḍhati.

Example1: mārassa vasaṃ gato, paṭimukkassa mārapāso. baddho so mārabandhanena yathākāmakaraṇīyo pāpimato.
Example 2:
dūraṅ'gamaṃ ekacaraṃ, asarīraṃ guhāsayaṃ,
ye cittaṃ saṃyamessanti, mokkhanti mārabandhanā.

Example1: seyyathā’pi bhikkhave ubhato-mukhā putoḷi pūrā nānāvihitassa dhaññassa seyyath’idaṃ sālīnaṃ vīhīnaṃ muggānaṃ māsānaṃ tilānaṃ taṇḍulānaṃ
Example 2:
paṇḍupalāso'va dāni'si, yamapurisā'pi ca te upaṭṭhitā,
uyyoga-mukhe ca tiṭṭhasi, pātheyyam'pi ca te na vijjati.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: becomes free; to be saved or released
Example1: seyyathā’pi puriso ābādhiko assa dukkhito bāḷha-gilāno, bhattañ’ca’ssa nacchādeyya, na c’assa kāye bala-mattā. so aparena samayena tamhā ābādhā mucceyya
Example 2:
na antalikkhe na samuddamajjhe, na pabbatānaṃ vivaraṃ pavissa.
na vijjatī so jagati-ppadeso, yattha-ṭṭhito mucceyya pāpakammā.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: who lies; lying; lit. who speaks falsely
Example1: musāvādissa purisapuggalassa musāvādā veramaṇī hoti parinibbānāya. pisuṇavācassa purisapuggalassa pisuṇāya vācāya veramaṇī hoti parinibbānāya.
Example 2:
ekaṃ dhammaṃ atītassa, musāvādissa jantuno,
vitiṇṇaparalokassa, n'atthi pāpaṃ akāriyaṃ.

Example1: so socati kilamati paridevati urattāḷiṃ kandati, sammohaṃ āpajjati, moghaṃ vata me uṭṭhānaṃ, aphalo vata me vāyāmo’ti.
Example 2:
na tena thero so hoti, yen’assa palitaṃ siro,
paripakko vayo tassa, mogha-jiṇṇo’ti vuccati.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: wherever; where; lit. in whichever place
Example1:
gāme vā yadi v’āraññe, ninne vā yadi vā thale.
yattha arahanto viharanti, taṃ bhūmi-rāmaṇeyyakan”ti.
Example 2:
kaṇhaṃ dhammaṃ vippahāya, sukkaṃ bhāvetha paṇḍito,
okā anokam’āgamma, viveke yattha dūramaṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: when; whenever; lit. at whichever time
Example1: yadā tumhe attanā’va jāneyyātha — ‘ime dhammā kusalā, ime dhammā anavajjā, ime dhammā viññu-ppasatthā, ime dhammā samattā samādinnā hitāya sukhāya saṃvattantī’ti, atha tumhe upasampajja vihareyyātha.
Example 2:
sabbe saṅkhārā aniccā’ti, yadā paññāya passati.
atha nibbindati dukkhe, esa maggo visuddhiyā.

Example1:
na taṃ yāce yassa piyaṃ jigiṃse, desso hoti atiyācanāya,
nāgo maṇiṃ yācito brāhmaṇena, adassanaṃ'y'eva tad'ajjhagamā’ti.
Example 2:
saccaṃ bhaṇe na kujjheyya, dajjā appam'pi yācito,
etehi tīhi ṭhānehi, gacche devāna santike.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: given (as a gift); offered; lit. sacrificed
Example1: sammādiṭṭhiko kho pana hoti aviparīta-dassano — ‘atthi dinnaṃ atthi yiṭṭhaṃ atthi hutaṃ, atthi sukata-dukkaṭānaṃ kammānaṃ phalaṃ vipāko, atthi ayaṃ loko atthi paro loko, atthi mātā atthi pitā, …
Example 2:
yaṃ kiñci yiṭṭhaṃ va hutaṃ va loke, saṃvaccharaṃ yajetha puññapekkho,
sabbam'pi taṃ na catubhāgam'eti, abhivādanā ujugatesu seyyo.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: for whoever; to whom; for which; to such and such
Example1: amhākaṃ pana sakiṃ katāni santhatāni pañca’pi cha’pi vassāni honti, yesaṃ no dārakā uhadanti’pi ummihanti’pi undūrehi’pi khajjanti.
Example 2:
yesaṃ sambodhiyaṅgesu, sammā cittaṃ subhāvitaṃ,
ādānapaṭinissagge, anupādāya ye ratā,
khīṇ'āsavā jutimanto, te loke parinibbutā.

Example1: nippapañc’ārāmassa-ayaṃ dhammo nippapañca-ratino, n’āyaṃ dhammo papañc’ārāmassa papañca-ratino’ti
Example 2:
suññ'āgāraṃ paviṭṭhassa, santacittassa bhikkhuno,
amānusī rati hoti, sammā dhammaṃ vipassato.

Example1: tesaṃ rasa-pathaviṃ aṅguliyā sāyataṃ acchādesi, taṇhā ca tesaṃ okkami.
Example 2:
yathā'pi bhamaro pupphaṃ, vaṇṇagandham'aheṭhayaṃ,
paleti rasam'ādāya, evaṃ gāme munī care.

Example1: kattha āpo ca pathavī, tejo vāyo na gādhati, kattha dīghañ’ca rassañ’ca, aṇuṃ thūlaṃ subhāsubhaṃ, kattha nāmañ’ca rūpañ’ca, asesaṃ uparujjhatī’ti?
Example 2:
y'odha dīghaṃ va rassaṃ vā, aṇuṃ thūlaṃ subh'āsubhaṃ,
loke adinnaṃ n'ādiyati, tam'ahaṃ brūmi brāhmaṇaṃ.

Example1: “seyyathā’pi puriso sappi-kumbhaṃ vā tela-kumbhaṃ vā gambhīraṃ udaka-rahadaṃ ogāhitvā bhindeyya. tatra yā assa sakkharā vā kaṭhalā vā sā adhogāmī assa
Example 2:
yathā'pi rahado gambhīro, vippasanno anāvilo,
evaṃ dhammāni sutvāna, vippasīdanti paṇḍitā.

Example1: api ca kho mātugāmassa saddaṃ suṇāti tirokuṭṭaṃ vā tiropākāraṃ vā hasantiyā vā bhaṇantiyā vā gāyantiyā vā rodantiyā vā
Example 2:
na taṃ kammaṃ kataṃ sādhu, yaṃ katvā anutappati,
yassa assumukho rodaṃ, vipākaṃ paṭisevati.

Example1:
“saṅgha-lābhassa bhaṇḍanti, saṅghato paribāhirā.
para-lābho-pajīvantā, ahirīkā na lajjare.
Example 2:
alajjitāye lajjanti, lajjitāye na lajjare,
micchādiṭṭhisamādānā, sattā gacchanti duggatiṃ.

Example1: seyyathā’pi pākāro hoti ucco c’eva vitthato ca vāsana-lepana-sampanno ca, evam’evaṃ kho ariyasāvako paññavā hoti
Example 2:
aṭṭhīnaṃ nagaraṃ kataṃ, maṃsalohita-lepanaṃ,
yattha jarā ca maccu ca, māno makkho ca ohito.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: bad speech; verbal misconduct; misbehaviour in speech
Example1: atthi, bhikkhave, sattānaṃ kāyaduccaritaṃ vacīduccaritaṃ manoduccaritaṃ. tassa taṃ ṭhānaṃ abhiṇhaṃ paccavekkhato sabbaso vā duccaritaṃ pahīyati tanu vā pana hoti.
Example 2:
vacīpakopaṃ rakkheyya, vācāya saṃvuto siyā,
vacīduccaritaṃ hitvā, vācāya sucaritaṃ care.

Example1: seyyathā’pi gāvī taruṇa-vacchā thambañ’ca ālumpati vacchakañ’ca apacinati. evam’eva kho dhammatā esā diṭṭhisampannassa puggalassa
Example 2:
yāva hi vanatho na chijjati, aṇumatto'pi narassa nārisu,
paṭibaddhamano'va tāva so, vaccho khīrapako'va mātari.

Example1: mā ca vāt’ātape cārittaṃ anuyuñji, mā te vātātape cārittaṃ anuyuttassa rajosūkaṃ vaṇa-mukhaṃ anuddhaṃsesi.
Example 2:
pāṇimhi ce vaṇo n'āssa, hareyya pāṇinā visaṃ,
n'ābbaṇaṃ visam'anveti, n'atthi pāpaṃ akubbato.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: detached (from); disengaged (from); disentangled (from); unfettered (from); lit. unyoked (from)

Meaning IN CONTEXT: is purified; is cleansed; becomes pure

Example1: “ek’āyano ayaṃ maggo sattānaṃ visuddhiyā, soka-paridevānaṃ samatikkamāya, dukkha-domanassānaṃ atthaṅ’gamāya, ñāyassa adhigamāya, nibbānassa sacchikiriyāya, yad'idaṃ cattāro satipaṭṭhānā.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: tarnished; defiled; tainted; corrupted; impure; dirty
Example1:

Example1: ‘dīgharattam’idaṃ cittaṃ saṃkiliṭṭhaṃ rāgena dosena mohenā’ti. cittasaṃkilesā, bhikkhave, sattā saṃkilissanti; cittavodānā sattā visujjhanti.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: as essential; as substantial; as valuable

Example1: kiñ’hi siyā, bhikkhave, pheṇa-piṇḍe sāro?
Example 2:

Example1: yo pana bhikkhu jānaṃ sappāṇakaṃ udakaṃ tiṇaṃ vā mattikaṃ vā siñceyya vā siñcāpeyya vā, pācittiyaṃ.

na tena thero so hoti, yen'assa palitaṃ siro,
paripakko vayo tassa, moghajiṇṇo'ti vuccati.

Example1: agginā ḍahitvā masiṃ kareyya. masiṃ karitvā mahāvāte vā ophuneyya, nadiyā vā sīgha-sotāya pavāheyya.
Example 2:
appamatto pamattesu, suttesu bahujāgaro,
abal'assaṃ'va sīgh'asso, hitvā yāti sumedhaso.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: in the habit of; accustomed to; of such nature; of such character
Example 2:
abhivādana-sīlissa, niccaṃ vuḍḍh’āpacāyino,
cattāro dhammā vaḍḍhanti, āyu vaṇṇo sukhaṃ balaṃ.

Example1: ime kho dve sukkā dhammā lokaṃ na pāleyyuṃ, na’y’idha paññāyetha mātā’ti vā mātucchā’ti vā mātulānī’ti vā ācariya-bhariyā’ti vā garūnaṃ dārā’ti
Example 2:
kaṇhaṃ dhammaṃ vippahāya, sukkaṃ bhāvetha paṇḍito,
okā anokam’āgamma, viveke yattha dūramaṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: wishing for happiness; fond of ease
Example1: atha puriso āgaccheyya jīvitu’kāmo amaritu’kāmo sukhakāmo dukkha-ppaṭikūlo.
Example 2:
sukhakāmāni bhūtāni, yo daṇḍena vihiṃsati,
attano sukham'esāno, pecca so na labhate sukhaṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: faring well; going well; doing well; fortunate; lit. well gone
Example1: so dibbena cakkhunā visuddhena atikkanta-mānusakena satte passati cavamāne upapajjamāne hīne paṇīte suvaṇṇe dubbaṇṇe, sugate duggate, yathākamm’ūpage satte pajānāti
Example 2:
cutiṃ yo vedi sattānaṃ, upapattiñ'ca sabbaso,
asattaṃ sugataṃ buddhaṃ, tam'ahaṃ brūmi brāhmaṇaṃ.

Example1:
anaṅgaṇassa posassa, niccaṃ sucigavesino.
vāl’agga-mattaṃ pāpassa, abbha-mattaṃ’va khāyati.
Example 2:
hirīmatā ca dujjīvaṃ, niccaṃ sucigavesinā,
alīnen'āppagabbhena, suddhājīvena passatā.

Example1:
kati jāgarataṃ suttā, kati suttesu jāgarā.
katīhi rajam’ādeti, katīhi parisujjhatī”ti.
Example 2:
appamatto pamattesu, suttesu bahujāgaro,
abal'assaṃ'va sīgh'asso, hitvā yāti sumedhaso.

Example1: yadā ca buddhā lokasmiṃ, uppajjanti pabhaṅ’karā. te imaṃ dhammaṃ pakāsenti, dukkh’ūpasama-gāminaṃ. tesaṃ sutvāna sappaññā, sacittaṃ paccaladdhā te.
Example 2:
yathā'pi rahado gambhīro, vippasanno anāvilo,
evaṃ dhammāni sutvāna, vippasīdanti paṇḍitā.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: extremely difficult to cross; very hard to escape
Example 2:
ye ca kho sammad-akkhāte, dhamme dhamm’ānuvattino,
te janā pāram’essanti, maccudheyyaṃ suduttaraṃ.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: drinking wine and spirits; drinking alcohol
Example1: surāmerayapāne, pācittiyaṃ.
Example 2:
surāmerayapānañ'ca, yo naro anuyuñjati,
idh'eva'm'eso lokasmiṃ, mūlaṃ khaṇati attano.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: with well liberated mind; with completely free heart
Example1: saṃvijjati kho, āvuso, bhagavato cakkhu. passati bhagavā cakkhunā rūpaṃ. chandarāgo bhagavato n’atthi. suvimuttacitto bhagavā.
Example 2:
appam'pi ce sahitaṃ bhāsamāno, dhammassa hoti anudhammacārī,
rāgañ'ca dosañ'ca pahāya mohaṃ, sammappajāno suvimuttacitto,
anupādiyāno idha vā huraṃ vā, sa bhāgavā sāmaññassa hoti.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: resolutely undertaken; fully taken on; energetically undertaken
Example1: ’mettāya ceto-vimuttiyā āsevitāya bhāvitāya bahulīkatāya yānīkatāya vatthukatāya anuṭṭhitāya paricitāya susamāraddhāya ekādas’ānisaṃsā pāṭikaṅkhā.
Example 2:
yesañ'ca susamāraddhā, niccaṃ kāyagatā sati,
akiccaṃ te na sevanti, kicce sātaccakārino,
satānaṃ sampajānānaṃ, atthaṃ gacchanti āsavā.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: well restrained (in); well controlled (in); well guarded (in)
Example1: susaṃvuto antaraghare gamissāmī’ti sikkhā karaṇīyā.
Example 2:
asubh'ānupassiṃ viharantaṃ, indriyesu susaṃvutaṃ,
bhojanamhi ca mattaññuṃ, saddhaṃ āraddhavīriyaṃ,
taṃ ve nappasahati māro, vāto selaṃ'va pabbataṃ.

Example1: idha gihīhi saṃsaṭṭho viharati, sahanandī saha-sokī, sukhitesu sukhito, dukkhitesu dukkhito, uppannesu kiccakaraṇīyesu attanā tesu yogaṃ āpajjati. ayaṃ vuccati manussaggāho.
Example 2:
pamādaṃ appamādena, yadā nudati paṇḍito,
paññāpāsādam'āruyha, asoko sokiniṃ pajaṃ,
pabbataṭṭho'va bhūmaṭṭhe, dhīro bāle avekkhati.

Example1: abhabbo’va tāva kālaṃ kātuṃ yāva na sot’āpattiphalaṃ sacchikaroti.
Example 2:
pathabyā ekarajjena, saggassa gamanena vā,
sabbalok’ādhipaccena, sot’āpattiphalaṃ varaṃ.

Example1:
yo cetā parivajjeti, sappasse’va padā siro.
so’maṃ visattikaṃ loke, sato samativattati.
Example 2:
yo ca pubbe pamajjitvā, pacchā so nappamajjati,
so'maṃ lokaṃ pabhāseti, abbhā mutto'va candimā.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: as; according to; by means (of); in ways (of) (distributive suffix)
Example1: ubhayāni kho pana me pātimokkhāni vitthārena svāgatāni honti suvibhattāni suppavattīni suvinicchitāni sutta-so anubyañjana-so.
Example 2:
yo ca sameti pāpāni, aṇuṃ thūlāni sabba-so.
samitattā hi pāpānaṃ, “samaṇo”ti pavuccati.

uyyuñjanti satīmanto, na nikete ramanti te,
haṃsā’va pallalaṃ hitvā, okam’okaṃ jahanti te.

Example1: hirīmā’yaṃ, bhikkhave, ottāpī appamatto hoti. so appamatto samāno bhabbo anādariyaṃ pahātuṃ dovacassataṃ pahātuṃ pāpamittataṃ pahātuṃ.
Example 2:
hirīmatā ca dujjīvaṃ, niccaṃ sucigavesinā,
alīnena-appagabbhena, suddhājīvena passatā.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: offered; lit. burnt in fire as an offering
Example1: sammādiṭṭhiko kho pana hoti aviparīta-dassano — ‘atthi dinnaṃ atthi yiṭṭhaṃ atthi hutaṃ, atthi sukata-dukkaṭānaṃ kammānaṃ phalaṃ vipāko, atthi ayaṃ loko atthi paro loko, atthi mātā atthi pitā, …
Example 2:
yaṃ kiñci yiṭṭhaṃ va hutaṃ va loke, saṃvaccharaṃ yajetha puññapekkho,
sabbam'pi taṃ na catubhāgam'eti, abhivādanā ujugatesu seyyo.

Example1: na h'eva kho pana paṭicchannaṃ āsanaṃ hoti, n'ālaṃ-kammaniyaṃ, alañ'ca kho hoti mātugāmaṃ duṭṭhullāhi vācāhi obhāsituṃ
Example 2:
pupphāni h'eva pacinantaṃ, byāsattamanasaṃ naraṃ,
suttaṃ gāmaṃ mah'ogho'va, maccu ādāya gacchati.
